thread.title: Fla. bystander shot to death trying to stop gunman who then killed wife, himself
thread.title_full: Fla. bystander shot to death trying to stop gunman who then killed wife, himself | OregonLive.com

author: Associated Press
title: Fla. bystander shot to death trying to stop gunman who then killed wife, himself
text:
INGLIS, Fla. â€” Three people are dead and one is critically injured after a shooting Thursday at a north Florida home, authorities said.
Among those killed was a bystander who tried to stop the gunman, police said.
Authorities believe a 57-year-old man shot the bystander and one other man about 6 p.m. on the lawn of a home in Inglis, about 50 miles from Gainesville, Levy County Sheriff's Office spokesman Lt. Scott Tummond said. One was killed and the other was critically injured.
Tummond said the man then entered the house and fatally shot his estranged wife before killing himself. Two guns were recovered.
Tummond says the home belonged to the injured victim, whose relationship with the shooter and his wife wasn't immediately clear. Police believe the man fatally shot on the lawn was a bystander who tried to intervene. Authorities did not immediately release names of those involved.
The incident came hours after a gunman opened fire at an Oregon community college , killing at least nine people before dying in a shootout with police.
